passages.text: We update our model post 2Q25 results and upgrade CEAB to Buy, from Neutral. Company enters Q3 with a solid balance sheet at 0.3x ND/EBITDA, having paid all obligations related to C&A Pay. C&A now has an open road to resume investments, including higher logistics CAPEX and more ambitious footprint expansion. In addition to its solid BS, we believe the further realization of its R\(1.4bn recoverable taxes (as of Q2) makes CEAB fully equipped to fund this expansion. As we adjust our medium-term growth prospects (2027 onwards), we see CEAB having a better growth story funded by its own sizeable cash generation (9%/10% FCF yield 2026E/27E). Higher FCF also means lower net financial expenses, translating into higher earnings (+11%/+8% for 2025E/2026E). **Price Performance**
(RIC: CEAB3.SA, BB: CEAB3 BZ)
**João Pedro Soares** AC

Citi Research is a division of Citigroup Global Markets Inc. (the "Firm"), which does and seeks to do business with companies covered in its research reports. As a result, investors should be aware that the Firm may have a conflict of interest that could affect the objectivity of this report. Investors should consider this report as only a single factor in making their investment decision. Certain products (not inconsistent with the author's published research) are available only on Citi's portals.

CEABeverages at 0.3x ND/EBITDA and the company should continue operating FCFOelped by accretive WC and realization/monetization (cash) of recoverable taxes. We estimate CEAB should generate R\\$258mn in FCF in 2H25 and R\\$465mn (9% FCF yield) in 2026, with contribution of tax monetization of R\\$139/291mn in 2H25/2026.

With a sturdier balance sheet and additional cash derived from tax monetization, mgmt. already confirmed CEAB's expansion to 15- 20 new stores (vs. Citi's old est. of 12) and R\\$200- 250mn on new logistics capabilities. With the right infrastructure, we see MSD area for the next couple of years driving DD apparel top- line growth.

With this context of higher (self- funded) growth and the potential expansion of logistics, we are more constructive on the case. We also increase our earnings after assuming better FCF - at our new earnings forecasts, we see C&A trading below 10x, which allows for a good entry point into the story again, in our view. Key potential downside to EBITDA/earnings is higher OPEX with the new openings.

Our DCF- derived TP now includes NPV from cash flows derived from the monetization of R\\$1.4bn recoverable taxes. As of Q2, C&A had R\\$1.4bn of recoverable taxes, which includes extempore PIS/COFINS (which originates from one- off tax reimbursements), current PIS/COFINS, ICMS and others.
Figure 1.Breakdown of Recoverable Taxes in R\\$ mn
\((\widehat{\Xi})\) 2025 Citigroup Inc.No redistribution without Citigroup's written permission. Source:Citi Research

In our previous model, we were assuming that most of the realization of these tax credits would be offset by further accumulation of new ones. However, C&A has been monetizing more on previous quarters (recoverable taxes were down nearly R\\$190mn this year).

With various changes in the last few years regarding limits of usage of extempore/current taxes (e.g. MP 1202/2023), CEAB is no longer accumulating credits to accrue interests. Instead, CEAB is opting to monetize as much as possible. We expect C&A to accelerate the realization of both extempore and current credits (especially PIS/COFINS, which represent 75% of recoverable taxes).

In Figure 2, we assume that C&A could fully monetize (cash) R\\$139/291/250mn at 2H25/2026/2027, i.e. net of accrual interest on existent extempore credits. To simplify, we assume 70% of realized taxes for 2H25, and 60% for 2026 and 2027. In our model, NPV of the realization made through 2026- 29E equates to R\\$2.0/sh.
Figure 2. Net Monetization of Tax Credits

The two figures below essentially summarize our more constructive thesis. We now see higher store openings (~5%/4%/4% area growth), adding to the current existing productivity (sales/sqm) gains. Additionally, C&A should advance its logistics expansion entirely self-funded by tax credit monetization and efficient WC.
Figure 3. Area Growth of ~5%/4%/4% for 2026E/27E/28E

Figure 4. Accompanied by High FCF (9%/10%/10% FCF Yield for 2026E/27E/28E

Source: Citi Research, Company Reports

After the Q2 miss on Apparel SSS (17% vs. CitiE of 18%), we fine-tune our numbers for the rest of the year. We still expect FY Apparel SSS at low teens and slightly revise up our number for 2026 (at 7.5%), as we assume further penetration of C&A Pay to drive some outperformance vs. peers.

Note we adjust Fashiontronics/Beauty, assuming a more gradual phase-out of electronics, which should also affect 2026 numbers. These ultimately have limited effects on top-line for 2025/2026. We note, however, that we raise sales area
growth through 2025E/2027E, which leads to higher medium-term growth and justifies the top line increase for 2027E.

On GM, we revise up our margin estimates for apparel after the Q2 beat of \(\sim 50\) bps. We also increase the GM of Fashiontronics - despite the more gradual phase- out, the unit GM has been better than CitiE for several consecutive quarters. On OPEX, we raise our G&A forecasts after Q2 came \(14\%\) above CitiE and slightly increase our estimated net credit losses as well. For 2026, we expect lower net credit losses as C&A should originate less on credit (lower duration). With higher recurring cash SG&A, Citi's adj. EBITDA pre IFRS is slightly down for 2025E/2026E/2027E.

The main positive changes are below the operating line. With higher FCF, we expect C&A to post better net financial results (lower net expenses). Hence, despite the lower EBITDA, we raise recurring earnings by \(11\% /8\%\) for 2025E/2026E.
Figure 5.Full Consolidated Est Changes Post Q2 2025:Higher Sales

We are replacing our positive Short- Term View with a more confident Catalyst Watch.
Direction: Upside Duration: Within 90 Days, expected event date 05 Nov 2025 Catalyst: Earnings

We see the second half of Q3 with easier comps. Preliminary sales index points to acceleration through the second half of Aug and Sep. C&A is also showing greater penetration of financial services with lower- duration credit (ideal for WC). Within this context and given the possibility of further realization of tax credits + mgmt is being more vocal about expansion; we expect the stock to further re- rate.
Spread 59pp Current Price and expected returns (upside/downside) as of 28 Aug 2025
10% higher revenues 100bps higher EBITDA margin
In- line revenues In- line EBITDA margin
10% lower revenues 100bps lower EBITDA margin

C&A Brasil is the second- largest apparel company in Brazil. It currently owns \(>330\) stores in 26 states (mainly in the southeast) and three distribution centers (two in São Paulo and one in Rio de Janeiro). The company's main focus is on affordable clothing ( \(\sim 80\%\) of sales) with a product assortment that includes shoes, outfits and beauty products and a target audience that consists mainly of young women (between ages of 18 and 35). C&A's brand operates mainly A- /B/C+ consumers while offering a balanced mix of "affordable" fashion items. C&A stores are mainly located on malls under a single store concept - average size of \(1.8k\) sqm.

We have a Buy rating on CEAB. We are more optimistic on CEAB's growth plans as the company's balance sheet is solid even after paying all its outstanding obligations to Bradesco (related to C&A Pay). Additionally, we see CEAB further monetizing on tax credits that should help fund its store expansion plan and investments to enhance logistics infrastructure as well. With all these elements factored into our numbers, we find a good risk/reward.

We have a DCF- based target price of \(\) 21.00\(. We derive our target price based on a discounted cash flow to equity model. We use a cost of equity (Ke) of\) 14.7\%\$ , which is the result of a \(4.3\%\) risk- free rate in dollars, \(2.4\%\) country risk, \(5.5\%\) equity premium, 1.1 beta, and a \(2\%\) inflation differential between Brazil and the US. Nominal growth (g) is set at \(4.4\%\) .

Risks to our thesis include: 1) higher OPEX to fund expansion (lower earnings), 2) lower apparel demand (macro deterioration), 3) overseas competition (cross border) potentially benefits from resumption of federal tax exemption. Last, 4) tax changes somehow inhibit full realization of tax credits.

Citi Research stock recommendations include an investment rating and an optional risk rating to highlight high risk stocks. Risk rating takes into account both price volatility and fundamental criteria. Stocks will either have no risk rating or a High risk rating assigned.

Investment Ratings: Citi Research investment ratings are Buy, Neutral and Sell. Our ratings are a function of analyst expectations of expected total return ("ETR") and risk. ETR is the sum of the forecast price appreciation (or depreciation) plus the dividend yield for a stock within the next 12 months. The target price is based on a 12 month time horizon. The Investment rating definitions are: Buy (1) ETR of \(15\%\) or more or \(25\%\) or more for High risk stocks; and Sell (3) for negative ETR. Any covered stock not assigned a Buy or a Sell is a Neutral (2). For stocks rated Neutral (2), if an analyst believes that there are insufficient valuation drivers and/or investment catalysts to derive a positive or negative investment view, they may elect with the approval of Citi Research management not to assign a target price and, thus, not derive an ETR. Citi Research may suspend its rating and target price and assign "Rating Suspended" status for regulatory and/or internal policy reasons. Citi Research may also suspend its rating and target price and assign "Under Review" status for other exceptional circumstances (e.g. lack of information critical to the analyst's thesis, trading suspension) affecting the company and/or trading in the company's securities. In both such situations, the rating and target price will show as "—" and "–" respectively in the rating history price chart. Prior to 11 April 2022 Citi Research assigned "Under Review" status to both situations and prior to 11 Nov 2020 only in exceptional circumstances. As soon as practically possible, the analyst will publish a note re-establishing a rating and investment thesis. Investment ratings are determined by the ranges described above at the time of initiation of coverage, a change in investment and/or risk rating, or a change in target price (subject to limited management discretion). At times, the expected total returns may fall outside of these ranges because of market price movements and/or other short-term volatility or trading patterns. Such interim deviations will be permitted but will become subject to review by Research Management. Your decision to buy or sell a security should be based upon your personal investment objectives and should be made only after evaluating the stock's expected performance and risk.

Catalyst Watch/Short Term Views ("STV") Ratings Disclosure: Catalyst Watch and STV Upside/Downside calls: Citi Research may also include a Catalyst Watch or STV Upside or Downside call to indicate the analyst expects the share price to rise (fall) in absolute terms over a specified period of 30 or 90 days in reaction to one or more specific near- term catalysts or events impacting the company or the market. A Catalyst Watch will be published when Analyst confidence is high that an impact to share price will occur; it will be a STV when confidence level is moderate. A Catalyst Watch or STV Upside/Downside call will automatically expire at the end of the specified 30/90 day period. The Catalyst Watch will also be automatically removed if share price performance (calculated at market close) exceeds 15% against the direction of the call (unless over- ridden by the analyst). The analyst may also remove a Catalyst Watch or STV call prior to the end of the specified period in a published research note. A Catalyst Watch/STV Upside or Downside call may be different from and does not affect a stock's fundamental equity rating, which reflects a longer- term total absolute return expectation. For purposes of FINRA ratings- distribution- disclosure rules, a Catalyst Watch/STV Upside call corresponds to a buy recommendation and a Catalyst Watch/STV Downside call corresponds to a sell recommendation. Any stock not assigned to a Catalyst Watch Upside, Catalyst Watch Downside, STV Upside, or STV Downside call is considered Catalyst Watch/STV No View. For purposes of FINRA ratings distribution- disclosure rules, we correspond Catalyst Watch/STV No View to Hold in our ratings distribution table for our Catalyst Watch/STV Upside/Downside rating system. However, we reiterate that we do not consider No View to be a recommendation. For all Catalyst Watch/STV Upside/Downside calls, risk exists that the catalyst(s) and associated share- price movement will not materialize as expected.
